DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective of the study is to show similarity of efficacy on Pulmicort Respules 1.0 mg/day or 2.0 mg/day for 6 weeks in the treatment period and the corresponding doses of Pulmicort Turbuhaler 400 μg/day or 800 μg/day for 4 weeks in the observation period in Japanese adult asthmatic patients with age of 16 years or older.
DOC.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of Pulmicort Respules in Japanese Adult Asthmatic Patients
DOC.criteria: Provision of informed consent prior to any study specific procedures. A minimum of 6 months documented history of asthma according to the JGL 2006 definition Asthma patients under prescribed treatment with ICS at least 3 months before Visit 2. Current or previous tobacco smokers with a history of >= 10 packyears Use of βblockers including eye drops Clinically significant respiratory infection affecting the asthma, as judged by the investigator(s) within 4 weeks prior to visit 2 Intake of oral, rectal or parenteral GCS within 4 weeks prior to Visit 2
